definition: Winston Churchill (1874-1965), UK politican and prime minister 1940-1945 and 1951-1955/surname Churchill
mound
surname Qiu
lucky/giga- (meaning billion or 10^9)
surname Ji/abbr. for Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3]
variant of 爾|尔[er3]
thus/so/like that/you/thou

sentences.english: Mr. Knightley, in his turn, saw signs of some secret agreement between Jane Fairfax and Frank Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 而奈特利先生则觉察到简和邱吉尔之间已有某种秘约。

sentences.english: Churchills were also in town; and they were only waiting for November.
sentences.chinese: 两位邱吉尔先生也在伦敦，只等着十一月份来临。

sentences.english: But Churchill understood that you start taking shortcuts, it corrodes the character of a country.
sentences.chinese: 但是邱吉尔深知，一旦走了捷径就将动摇该国的国本。

sentences.english: Perhaps Beckham is heeding Churchill, who had a penchant for pigs.
sentences.chinese: 也许贝克汉姆夫妇留意到邱吉尔也很喜欢猪。

sentences.english: Winston Churchill exemplified integrity an respect in the face of opposition.
sentences.chinese: 邱吉尔就是面对反对派体现完全尊重的一个典型。

sentences.english: The Socialists were trying to smear Churchill as a warmonger.
sentences.chinese: 工党企图诽谤邱吉尔先生是战争贩子。

sentences.english: The plan rode rough-shed over Churchill's cherished ideas.
sentences.chinese: 这项计划粗暴地粉碎了邱吉尔的宿愿。

sentences.english: Walden saw Churchill pushing through the crowd toward where they sat.
sentences.chinese: 沃尔登看见邱吉尔在人群中向他们坐的地方挤过来。

sentences.english: Early on the third morning Hoprins visited Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 第三天清早，霍普金斯谒见了邱吉尔。

sentences.english: Churchill's cadences began to roll out of the short-wave radio .
sentences.chinese: 短波电台里开始传出邱吉尔那抑扬顿挫的声调。

definition: variant of 邱吉爾|邱吉尔[Qiu1 ji2 er3]
Roosevelt (name)/Theodore Roosevelt (1858-1919), US President 1901-1909/Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945), US President 1933-1945
Dwight D. Eisenhower (1890-1969), US army general and politician, Supreme Allied Commander in Europe during World War II, US President 1953-1961
Mrs Thatcher/Baroness Thatcher or Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013), British conservative politician, prime minister 1979-1990
Adolf Hitler (1889-1945)
Joseph Stalin (1879-1953), Soviet dictator
Benito Mussolini (1883-1945), Italian fascist dictator, "Il Duce", president 1922-1943
Napoleon (name)/Napoleon Bonaparte (1769-1821), Emperor of France 1804-1815
variant of 拿破崙|拿破仑[Na2 po4 lun2]
George Bernard Shaw (1856-1950), Irish dramatist and writer
Charlie Chaplin (1899-1977), English movie actor and director

Mountbatten (name, Anglicization of German Battenberg)/Lord Louis Mountbatten, 1st Earl Mountbatten of Burma (1900-1979), British commander in Southeast Asia during WWII, presided over the partition of India in 1947, murdered by the IRA.
Joseph Goebbels (1897-1945), German Nazi leader and politician
Thatcher (name)/Baroness Thatcher or Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013), British conservative politician, prime minister 1979-1990
Richard Nixon (1913-1994), US president 1969-1974/surname Nixon
General Douglas MacArthur (1880-1964), US commander in Pacific during WW2, sacked in 1951 by President Truman for exceeding orders during the Korean war
pinyin: Dao4 ge2 la1 si1 · Mai4 ke4 a1 se4

definition: Nazi Germany (1933-1945)
